sections.heading: of guilty; accused to be notified before sentence
sections.text: Before the sentence is pronounced, the defendant must be informed by the court of the verdict of the jury, and asked whether he has anything to say why judgment should not be passed against him.SourceG.S.1873, c. 58, ยง 495, p. 832;R.S.1913, ยง 9136;C.

sections.heading: mandatory; if not complied with, cause will be remanded
sections.text: Evers v. State, 84 Neb. 708, 121 N.W. 1005 (1909); McCormick v. State, 66 Neb. 337, 92 N.W. 606 (1902).
